contentrichtext.text: '''Baron McNair''', of Gleniffer in the County of Renfrew, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1955 for the lawyer and judge [[Arnold McNair, 1st Baron McNair|Sir Arnold McNair]]. He was the first President of the [[European Court of Human Rights]]. {{As of|2010}} the title is held by his grandson, the third Baron, who succeeded his father in 1989. ==Barons McNair (1955)== *[[Arnold McNair, 1st Baron McNair|Arnold Duncan McNair, 1st Baron McNair]] (1885–1975) *Clement John McNair, 2nd Baron McNair (1915–1989) *Duncan James McNair, 3rd Baron McNair (b. 1947) ==Notes== {{unreferenced|date=February 2013}} {{reflist}} ==References== *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990, {{Page needed |date=February 2013}} *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:McNair}} [[Category:Baronies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
